page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY 1945
page.content: There were few changes between 1925-45 due to a shortage of money and the advent of{World War 2}The two mills were closed and the machinery sold for scrap.During the war the young were coscripted and others went into the valley to work.A {decoy town}was built on Manshead Moor and lit up to attract the German bombers.By 1945 { {electricity }had arrived at the Day School premises.The small outlandish farms became vacant and derelict.Fewer Irish labourers came as horse drawn grass cutting machines were used above the valleys on the flatter land.There was{very little social life}The church,the working men's clubs and the public houses were still important as focal points.Many homes had {wireless} sets run by accumulators.
